      Create an ArrayList with an array of paths, checking to see if they exist if b = true
      SourceFilesList​(java.lang.String[] path, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> extensions)
      Create an ArrayList with an array of paths, checking to see if they exist and adding files found in directories if they match the file extensions present in extensions.

        public SourceFilesList​(java.lang.String[] str,
                       boolean b)
                throws java.nio.file.NoSuchFileException
        Create an ArrayList with an array of paths, checking to see if they exist if b = true

        b - The boolean to determine whether or not to check if the files exist
        Throws:
        java.nio.file.NoSuchFileException

      • SourceFilesList

        public SourceFilesList​(java.lang.String[] path,
                       java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> extensions)
                throws java.nio.file.NoSuchFileException
        Create an ArrayList with an array of paths, checking to see if they exist and adding files found in directories if they match the file extensions present in extensions. This is used primarily to call addRecursive on directories and add on normal files specified directly, since it seems more useful to be able to analyze, for example, c_code_wip.txt in addition to normal C++ files without having to analyze every file ending in .txt.
        Parameters:
        path - The array of paths to construct the SourceFiles
        extensions - The collection of extensions to require the files to match, if they were specified through a directory
        Throws:
        java.nio.file.NoSuchFileException

         throws java.nio.file.NoSuchFileException
        Add a single path if it ends in an extension contained in the ArrayList extensions
        Parameters:

        extensions - The collection of extensions to require the file to match

        Parameters:
